<!-- Generated by Harlequin Webmaker 2.1.3; Transducer 1.0.2 --> <HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE> The ACES Project</TITLE> </HEAD> <BODY> <A NAME=HEADING110></A> <A HREF="AR95Book-111.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bnext.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-109.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bprev.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-66.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bup.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Btop.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bcontent.gif"></A><BR><A HREF="AR95Book-111.html">[Next] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-109.html">[Previous] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-66.html">[Up] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html">[Top] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html">[Contents]</A> <P> <A NAME=HEADING110-0></A> <H1> The ACES Project</H1> Principal Investigators: <A HREF=AR95Book-36.html>Vernon J. Rego</A>, Vaidy Sunderam<P> Research Assistant: B. Dimitrov, J.-C. Gomez, F. Knop, E. Mascarenhas, R. Pasquini, J. Sang<P> Sponsor: ONR, ARO, DoE, NSF, PRF<P> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> <P> The ACES system is a layered software architecture for high-performance distributed computation and simulation, including the Ariadne/Arachne threads systems, the Conch/Clam communications environments and a multithreaded CMPI subsystem, the EcliPSe replicated simulation system and the (para)Sol process-oriented simulation environment. The system is process- and object- oriented, supporting applications on heterogeneous network environments made up of machines ranging from desktop workstations to massively parallel hardware multiprocessors.<P> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> <ADDRESS>CS Annual Report - 19 APR 1996</ADDRESS> <A HREF="AR95Book-111.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bnext.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-109.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bprev.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-66.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bup.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Btop.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bcontent.gif"></A><BR><A HREF="AR95Book-111.html">[Next] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-109.html">[Previous] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-66.html">[Up] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html">[Top] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html">[Contents]</A> <P> </BODY> </HTML> </HTML>
